title: I'm actually surprised at the effort Riot made to destroy ARURF
body: Limiting the champ pool and forcing snowball. It's not like anyone asked for it. Why???? Who came up with this idea???

If what you want is a persistent URF queue (and many people do, I think), this doesn't really cut it. It only comes around a few times a year, so extra limitations only bring it down further. On top of that, I think those extra limitations haven't been clearly communicated. 

For clarity, none of this bothers me, personally. I've never loved URF. But I see why the people that *do* love URF are disappointed. It makes sense.

AR was implemented so that people wouldn't pick the same champs over and over, basically creating an URF meta that Riot had to address. Given that URF is a temporary, time-sensitive queue - Riot doesn't need to control the meta as much but will still deal with outliers if they're way out of line and making the side they're on win/lose hard. A limited champ pool was then introduced to also curbstomp accounts who only buy specific ARAM/URF strong champs and don't specifically have any weak picks.

Now, this champ pool was made from champs who have a Christmas skin, ice skin or a festive skin at the least (Whistler Village Twitch, Festive Kassadin). Lissandra actually uses her base skin from what i saw. This champ pool is maybe not to your liking but it being an AR mode already removes the choice of your picks so there should be no problems there. And even if Riot picks the comps, there are still champs that can be classified as broken, currently being Mao/Fizz, Sivir. So it's not really Riot's handpicked team that forces people into playing underwhelming champions. 

The inclusion of Snowball also helps equalize melee champions in terms of ranged vs melee comps. What is most dissatisfying is that ranged champions often can spam their things from a safe range and if you ever get dealt a melee champ that can't really do anything but take the abuse, you're going to have a bad time. The snowball allows you to reach your lane faster and it also serves as a reliable gap closer to those ranged champs to feel threatened.
